speaker: POINS
text_entry: SCENE III. Warkworth castle

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Enter HOTSPUR, solus, reading a letter

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: 'But for mine own part, my lord, I could be well

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: contented to be there, in respect of the love I bear

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: your house.' He could be contented: why is he not,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: then? In respect of the love he bears our house:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: he shows in this, he loves his own barn better than

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: he loves our house. Let me see some more. 'The

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: purpose you undertake is dangerous;'--why, that's

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: certain: 'tis dangerous to take a cold, to sleep, to

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: drink; but I tell you, my lord fool, out of this

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: nettle, danger, we pluck this flower, safety. 'The

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: purpose you undertake is dangerous; the friends you

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: have named uncertain; the time itself unsorted; and

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: your whole plot too light for the counterpoise of so

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: great an opposition.' Say you so, say you so? I say

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: unto you again, you are a shallow cowardly hind, and

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: you lie.  What a lack-brain is this! By the Lord,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: our plot is a good plot as ever was laid; our

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: friends true and constant: a good plot, good

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: friends, and full of expectation; an excellent plot,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: very good friends. What a frosty-spirited rogue is

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: this! Why, my lord of York commends the plot and the

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: general course of action. 'Zounds, an I were now by

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: this rascal, I could brain him with his lady's fan.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Is there not my father, my uncle and myself? lord

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Edmund Mortimer, My lord of York and Owen Glendower?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: is there not besides the Douglas? have I not all

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: their letters to meet me in arms by the ninth of the

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: next month? and are they not some of them set

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: forward already? What a pagan rascal is this! an

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: infidel! Ha! you shall see now in very sincerity

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: of fear and cold heart, will he to the king and lay

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: open all our proceedings. O, I could divide myself

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: and go to buffets, for moving such a dish of

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: skim milk with so honourable an action! Hang him!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: let him tell the king: we are prepared. I will set

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: forward to-night.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Enter LADY PERCY

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: How now, Kate! I must leave you within these two hours.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: O, my good lord, why are you thus alone?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: For what offence have I this fortnight been

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: A banish'd woman from my Harry's bed?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Tell me, sweet lord, what is't that takes from thee

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Thy stomach, pleasure and thy golden sleep?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Why dost thou bend thine eyes upon the earth,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And start so often when thou sit'st alone?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Why hast thou lost the fresh blood in thy cheeks;

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And given my treasures and my rights of thee

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: To thick-eyed musing and cursed melancholy?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: In thy faint slumbers I by thee have watch'd,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And heard thee murmur tales of iron wars;

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Speak terms of manage to thy bounding steed;

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Cry 'Courage! to the field!' And thou hast talk'd

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Of sallies and retires, of trenches, tents,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Of palisadoes, frontiers, parapets,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Of basilisks, of cannon, culverin,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Of prisoners' ransom and of soldiers slain,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And all the currents of a heady fight.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Thy spirit within thee hath been so at war

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And thus hath so bestirr'd thee in thy sleep,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: That beads of sweat have stood upon thy brow

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Like bubbles in a late-disturbed stream;

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And in thy face strange motions have appear'd,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Such as we see when men restrain their breath

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: On some great sudden hest. O, what portents are these?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Some heavy business hath my lord in hand,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And I must know it, else he loves me not.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: What, ho!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Enter Servant

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Is Gilliams with the packet gone?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: He is, my lord, an hour ago.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Hath Butler brought those horses from the sheriff?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: One horse, my lord, he brought even now.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: What horse? a roan, a crop-ear, is it not?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: It is, my lord.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: That roan shall by my throne.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Well, I will back him straight: O esperance!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Bid Butler lead him forth into the park.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: But hear you, my lord.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: What say'st thou, my lady?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: What is it carries you away?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Why, my horse, my love, my horse.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Out, you mad-headed ape!

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: A weasel hath not such a deal of spleen

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: As you are toss'd with. In faith,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: I'll know your business, Harry, that I will.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: I fear my brother Mortimer doth stir

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: About his title, and hath sent for you

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: To line his enterprise: but if you go,--

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: So far afoot, I shall be weary, love.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Come, come, you paraquito, answer me

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Directly unto this question that I ask:

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: In faith, I'll break thy little finger, Harry,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: An if thou wilt not tell me all things true.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Away,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Away, you trifler! Love! I love thee not,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I care not for thee, Kate: this is no world

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To play with mammets and to tilt with lips:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: We must have bloody noses and crack'd crowns,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And pass them current too. God's me, my horse!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: What say'st thou, Kate? what would'st thou

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: have with me?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Do you not love me? do you not, indeed?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Well, do not then; for since you love me not,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: I will not love myself. Do you not love me?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Nay, tell me if you speak in jest or no.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Come, wilt thou see me ride?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And when I am on horseback, I will swear

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I love thee infinitely. But hark you, Kate;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I must not have you henceforth question me

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Whither I go, nor reason whereabout:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Whither I must, I must; and, to conclude,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: This evening must I leave you, gentle Kate.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I know you wise, but yet no farther wise

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Than Harry Percy's wife: constant you are,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: But yet a woman: and for secrecy,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: No lady closer; for I well believe

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Thou wilt not utter what thou dost not know;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And so far will I trust thee, gentle Kate.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: How! so far?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Not an inch further. But hark you, Kate:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Whither I go, thither shall you go too;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To-day will I set forth, to-morrow you.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Will this content you, Kate?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: It must of force.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Exeunt
